citations.narrative:
After the last attempted inspection, mailings have been returned to USDA as they could not be delivered as addressed.
No communication has been made by the registrant to USDA APHIS Animal Care to let the agency know of a mailing
address change. Failure to provide change of current address prevents Animal Care from inspecting and communicating
on adequate animal care and welfare. A registrant shall notify the Deputy Administrator by certified mail of any change in
the name, address, or ownership, or other change in operations affecting its status as an exhibitor, carrier, or intermediate
handler, within 10 days after making such change.
To be corrected by: 31-December-2024

citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
A responsible adult was not available to accompany APHIS Officials during the inspection process at 11:00AM on
12/16/2024. The inspector attempted to contact the licensee/registrant by knocking, calling and honking the car horn.
Failure to provide access to the facility, animals, and records for inspection is a serious violation of the AWA and
regulations. Failure to comply may result in enforcement action.
Additional Inspectors:
William Janecke, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICEREnd Section

narrative:
2.27(a) 
   
Notification of change of operation. 
After the last attempted inspection, mailings have been returned to USDA as they could not be delivered as addressed. 
No communication has been made by the registrant to USDA APHIS Animal Care to let the agency know of a mailing 
address change. Failure to provide change of current address prevents Animal Care from inspecting and communicating 
on adequate animal care and welfare. A registrant shall notify the Deputy Administrator by certified mail of any change in 
the name, address, or ownership, or other change in operations affecting its status as an exhibitor, carrier, or intermediate 
handler, within 10 days after making such change. 
To be corrected by: 31-December-2024 
2.126(b)  Repeat
   
Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries. 
A responsible adult was not available to accompany APHIS Officials during the inspection process at 11:00AM on 
12/16/2024. The inspector attempted to contact the licensee/registrant by knocking, calling and honking the car horn. 
Failure to provide access to the facility, animals, and records for inspection is a serious violation of the AWA and 
regulations. Failure to comply may result in enforcement action. 
 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
William Janecke, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICEREnd Section
